intro: Stylosanthes mitzii, commonly known as the smallleaf stylo, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often used in agricultural settings as a forage crop due to its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen. Stylosanthes mitzii thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for arid environments. Its seeds are also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
